meanings.definition: A roll or sound of a drum, especially as a signal or announcement.
meanings.sent1: The drummer played a loud drumroll to signal the start of the performance.
meanings.sent2: The audience clapped in excitement as the drumroll echoed through the hall.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic the drumroll by tapping its paws on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The drumroll of thunder in the distance warned of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The drumroll of the marching band filled the air with anticipation.

meanings.sent1: She practiced for hours to perfect her ability to drumroll on the snare drum.
meanings.sent2: The drummer will drumroll before the singer starts the song.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to drumroll on the pots and pans instead of clapping.
meanings.sent4: Her heart began to drumroll with excitement as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drumroll reverberated through the room, building up suspense.
